refnamediv.refpurpose: An emulation of a mini-Moog synthesizer.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: An emulation of a mini-Moog synthesizer.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares moog kamp, kfreq, kfiltq, kfiltrate, kvibf, kvamp, iafn, iwfn, ivfn

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: iafn, iwfn, ivfn -- three table numbers containing the attack waveform (unlooped), the main looping wave form, and the vibrato waveform. The files mandpluk.aiff and impuls20.aiff are suitable for the first two, and a sine wave for the last.

note.title: Note
note.para: The files mandpluk.aiff and impuls20.aiff are also available at ftp://ftp.cs.bath.ac.uk/pub/dream/documentation/sounds/modelling/.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kfiltq -- Q of the filter, in the range 0.8 to 0.9
kfiltrate -- rate control for the filter in the range 0 to 0.0002
kvibf -- frequency of vibrato in Hertz. Suggested range is 0 to 12

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the moog opcode. It uses the file moog.csd, mandpluk.aiff, and impuls20.aiff.
Example of the moog opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
